title: How about "reach 300,000 points and we bring back URF"
body:
How about "reach 300,000 points and we bring back URF"
k
EDIT: Downvoted by guy who got butthurt in URF

replies.body: Although I think having URF back would be cool, the fanaticism is ridiculous. Having URF back would be cool, but I would rather have a new featured gamemode any day, rather than a re-release of something. URF was cool, but so was hexakill (both forms), all for one (both forms), ascension, and all the others that aren't coming to mind just right now. And to be honest, I prefer them. They are bringing out Nemesis Draft, and I think that is gonna be more fun than a reboot of URF. Instead of having a bunch of people being toxic about being OP, we are going to have people being excused for not knowing champions, and people will be inspired to learn and play the unplayed champions. That sounds a lot better to me.

URF was fun, because URF was Quake 3 as opposed to... Civ? Spend X amount of turns before you're capable of taking on Rome?

URF is fun, it's fast, there's no minions, gold difference is irrelevant, it starts to become more about your skill with the champion and less about how many boring AI you've got the last hit on. Which is important, because minions are boring and gold differences are simply a way to make minions matter.

For instance, against a Nid/Jayce top lane, I was Malphite, friend was GP. Needless to say, GP had backed before 1mn thanks to the constant spears. But GP dropped a ward into the brush, Viktor TP'd up and came up behind, we converged on them and picked up first blood, and eventually won the game. Not because our champions were superior, not because we killed more boring AI who don't attack us unless we do something stupid, not because we had an advantage in lane, but because we could outplay the other people.

And that's the game I want to play.

And given how popular URF was, it seems a lot of other people think that way as well.
